com.dsi.ant.chip

Interface IAntChip

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AntChipBase

    public interface IAntChip
    This is the interface to an ANT Chip, which is an abstracted piece of ANT hardware.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setEventReceiver

        void setEventReceiver(IAntChipEventReceiver eventReceiver)
        The event callback has been updated.
        Parameters:
        eventReceiver - The reference used to call in to the ANT Radio Service.

      • txMessage

        boolean txMessage(byte[] message)
        Send a raw ANT packet to the hardware.
        Parameters:
        message - The raw ANT packet.

        The format is
        II JJ ------
        ^ ^
        | ANT Packet |

        where: II is the 1 byte size of the ANT data (0-249)
        JJ is the 1 byte ID of the ANT message (1-255, 0 is invalid)
        ------ is the data of the ANT message (0-249 bytes of data)

        Returns:
        True if packet was successfully sent, false otherwise.

      • txBurst

        boolean txBurst(int channel,
              byte[] data)
        Write complete raw data as burst messages to the chip.

        This method will only write to the ANT chip, any ANT events like EVENT_TRANSFER_TX_START should be handled by the higher level. You will get all channel response events. Thread timing may cause you to get more than one SEQUENCE_NUMBER_ERROR. This method will block until the whole burst is written, or until the burst has failed while writing. txBurst will stop blocking if a response event error is received. A burst can be interrupted by the user sending a 'close ANT channel' command to the chip which will stop and clean up the burst transmission. This method will pad data with zeros if it is not a multiple of 8 bytes.

        Parameters:
        channel - The ANT channel on which to burst. The bottom 5 bits of this number will be used as the ANT channel in the sequence byte. If the ANT chip does not have the desired channel it will send an invalid message response.
        data - The data to send. This does not include any ANT message information. This must be at least eight bytes of data.
        Returns:
        false if there was a physical error writing the burst to the chip. True if the data was successfully written, or a close channel command or response event interrupted writing the burst.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the data passed to it is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the data passed to it is less than 8 bytes long.

      • getChipState

        int getChipState()
        Retrieve the current status of this AntChip.
        Returns:
        One of the states listed in AntChipState

      • enable

        int enable()
        Power on the ANT chip.
        Returns:
        The state of the ANT chip at the time this function returns as one of the constants from AntChipState. Based on the return the chip will have acknowledged the request, ignored the request because it was busy doing something else, or may have produced an error while processing the request.

      • disable

        int disable()
        Power off the ANT chip.
        Returns:
        The state of the ANT chip at the time this function returns as one of the constants from AntChipState. Based on the return the chip will have acknowledged the request, ignored the request because it was busy doing something else, or may have produced an error while processing the request.

      • hardReset

        int hardReset()
        Initiate a hard reset on the underlying hardware.
        Returns:
        The state of the ANT chip at the time this function returns as one of the constants from AntChipState. Based on the return the chip will have acknowledged the request, ignored the request because it was busy doing something else or does not support a hard reset, or may have produced an error while processing the request.

      • getChipName

        java.lang.String getChipName()
        Get a human readable name for this chip. This string will be presented to the user in certain situations, so should be properly localised if applicable. This name does not need to be unique, it should only represent the specific type of hardware the chip is (eg. AP2 stick or emulator connection). Any unique identifying numbers will be added by the ARS before display.
        Returns:
        A (possibly localised) human readable string that represents this chip.

      • getHardwareType

        java.lang.String getHardwareType()
        Get the type of underlying hardware this AntChip represents. This should be one of the values that was listed in the "ANT_HardwareType" list in the service's metadata.
        Returns:
        One of the ANT_HARDWARE_TYPE_ constants from ChipProviderMetaData.
